Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Prof. Nirupama Mallick has been appointed as the Head of Agricultural and Food Engineering Department as well as Rural Development Centre with effect from Sept 1, 2017. She joined the institute in 2000. She has many awards and honours to her name including Alexander von Humboldt Fellowship (1997) and Woman Scientist Medal by Biotech Research Society of India (2005). Also, she is Indian National Science Academy (INSA) fellow.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Prof. Nirupama Mallick and wishes her all the best!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 31-08-2017 at 09:00PM
Entrepreneurship Cell

On Tuesday, Amancio Ortega, founder of ZARA clothing, 81, overtook tech supremo and and Microsoft founder Bill Gates to take the top spot on the global rich-list.
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Amancio Ortega for streaking ahead to leave a £155million gap between him and Gates!

Entrepreneurship Cell

After fintech company Capital Float and Mukesh Bansal and Ankit Nagori's cure.fit, budget-hotel tech company, Treebo Hotels has raised Series C funding of $34 million led by Hong-Kong based investment firms Ward Ferry Management and Karst Peak Capital. Existing investors SAIF Partners, Bertelsmann India Investments and Matrix Partners also participated in the round.
The funds are said to be used for building budget hotels, improving customer experience and expansion.

Fresher: I want to change my department what should I do?
Someone: Ask the people who made depc previous years.
Fresher:How?
Student Welfare Group:Make Your Choice!!

Hola Freshers!!
Student Welfare Group now provides you the solution of the most common fresher problem of IIT kharagpur.Department Change(depc) comes with What?How?Where? So here is the chance to 'Make Your Choice' by having a conversation with the people who made Depc in last years and get answers to all your queries.

Debating Society

Anjeeta Singh shared a video to Debating Society,IIT Kharagpur's Timeline.

#9thCNLUPD - REGISTRATIONS OPEN:

We are proud to announce that the first round of registrations for the 9th CNLU National Parliamentary Debate is now open.The first round of registration closes on the 20th of September. The links for registration are below, hurry and apply!

As this video takes you to a trip down the memory lane, a few details about the 9th CNLU National Parliamentary Debate that you must know:

• The dates of this 9th edition of the CNLU National Parliamentary Debate are 13th to 15th October, 2017.

• With cash prize worth rs.1.85 lacs at stake, you would not want to miss this!

• The tournament will follow a 3x3 Asian Parliamentary form of debating.

• It being an open tournament, age or institution will not play any role in your participation.

• The registration fee for the tournament is 1800/per participant which includes accommodation and food for all three days of the tournament. (9 meals)

• The Adj. Core panel comprises Taufique Shoogufan, Adhiraj Mukerji and Prasun Bhaiya.

Registration links:

http://bit.ly/2wSrfob - Institutional Teams!

http://bit.ly/2vsL0iz - Cross-Teams!

http://bit.ly/2xDwIN0 - Independent Adjudicator!

We are providing Adj. subsidies as well! CVs, in order to apply for Adj. subsidy, can be mailed to debsoc.cnlu@gmail.com.

For more details, call:

Shiksha- +918544148624
Somit- +919102937757

  • View the post
  • Posted on 30-08-2017 at 12:02AM

#9thCNLUPD - REGISTRATIONS OPEN:

We are proud to announce that the first round of registrations for the 9th CNLU National Parliamentary Debate is now open.The first round of registration closes on the 20th of September. The links for registration are below, hurry and apply! The Adj. subsidy CVs can be mailed to debsoc.cnlu@gmail.com.

As this video takes you to a trip down the memory lane, a few details about the 9th CNLU National Parliamentary Debate that you must know:

The dates of this 9th edition of the CNLU National Parliamentary Debate are 13th to 15th October, 2017. With cash prize worth rs.1.85 lacs at stake, you would not want to miss this! The tournament will follow a 3x3 Asian Parliamentary form of debating. It being an open tournament, age or institution will not play any role in your participation. The registration fee for the tournament is 1800/per participant which includes accommodation and food for all three days of the tournament. Apply below, get going:

  • Posted on 29-08-2017 at 11:16PM
The Scholar's Avenue

The Embassy of Sweden in India on 28th August organized Kolkata regional round of the eleventh edition of Sweden India Nobel Memorial quiz.

The theme of the quiz is Sweden, its history, culture and innovations, Nobel Prizes and the life and works of Alfred Nobel. Four teams from IIT KGP went to Kolkata for participating in the quiz. The cutoff of the prelims was 16 out of 25, and all KGP teams scored more than the cutoff but only one could proceed to the finals due to one team per institute rule. The quiz master seemed pretty impressed with the prowess of KGP teams and said that preparedness of KGP students is on another level.

In the finals, an IIT KGP team consisting of Amit Kumar Ram, Shreyans Sadangi and Piyush Kedia came on top, beating ISI and Heritage.

They will participate in the National finals in the first week of October in the Sweden India Nobel Memorial week. In 2013, a team from IIT KGP won the national finals; we hope the feat is repeated this year.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes them all the best for the upcoming finals.

Picture - IIT KGP students in Calcutta Medical College

  • View the post
  • Posted on 29-08-2017 at 11:16PM
The Scholar's Avenue

The Embassy of Sweden in India on 28th August organized Kolkata regional round of the eleventh edition of Sweden India Nobel Memorial quiz.
The theme of the quiz is Sweden, its history, culture and innovations, Nobel Prizes and the life and works of Alfred Nobel. Four teams from IIT KGP went to Kolkata for participating in the quiz. The cutoff of the prelims was 16 out of 25, and all KGP teams scored more than the cutoff but only one could proceed to the finals due to one team per institute rule. The quiz master seemed pretty impressed with the prowess of KGP teams, and said that preparedness of KGP students is on another level.
In the finals, an IIT KGP team consisting of Amit Kumar Ram, Shreyans Sadangi and Piyush Kedia came on top, beating ISI and Heritage.
They will participate in the National finals in the first week of October in the Sweden India Nobel Memorial week.
In 2014, a team from IIT KGP won the national finals, we hope the feat is repeated this year.
The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes them all the best for the upcoming finals.
Picture - IIT KGP students in Calcutta Medical College

  • View the post
  • Posted on 29-08-2017 at 10:21PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Students of IIT Kharagpur have again shown their mettle in quizzing and have made the quizzing circle across the country feel their dominant presence. A team of three IIT Kharagpur students Piyush Kedia, Shreyans Sadangi and Amit Kumar Ram won the recently concluded Kolkata regionals of Sweden India Nobel Memorial Quiz and advanced to the finals to be conducted on 11th October in Delhi. Out of more than 60 teams that participated in the regional round, only 6 teams made it to the finals. This quiz is conducted in 11 cities across India. In 2015 also, a team from IIT Kharagpur had won the Kolkata regionals. The stellar performance of KGPians can be gauged from the fact that all four teams from KGP actually advanced to the finals, but the rules had a stipulation that only one team from each college can be allowed to advance to the finals.
The Embassy of Sweden organises one of India’s most prestigious quiz contests annually – The Sweden-India Nobel Memorial Quiz. The quiz series is part of the Sweden India Nobel Memorial Week – now in its eleventh year.
The broad theme of the quiz is Alfred Nobel and his life and achievements, the Nobel Prize, Nobel Laureates and their achievements, Sweden, its people and their culture, Swedish innovations and inventions. Members of the winning team win a week-long visit to Sweden where they will visit Swedish companies, universities and the Nobel Museum.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them for their marvellous performance and wishes them all the best for finals!

Picture Credits - Sweden in India

  • View the post
  • Posted on 29-08-2017 at 10:21PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Students of IIT Kharagpur have again shown their mettle in quizzing and have made the quizzing circle across the country feel their dominant presence. A team of three IIT Kharagpur students Piyush Kedia, Shreyans Sadangi and Amit Kumar Ram won the recently concluded Kolkata regionals of Sweden India Nobel Memorial Quiz and advanced to the finals to be conducted on 11th October in Delhi. Out of more than 60 teams that participated in the regional round, only 6 teams made it to the finals. This quiz is conducted in 11 cities across India. In 2015 also, a team from IIT Kharagpur had won the Kolkata regionals. The stellar performance of KGPians can be gauged from the fact that all four teams from KGP actually advanced to the finals, but the rules had a stipulation that only one team from each college can be allowed to advance to the finals.
The Embassy of Sweden organises one of India’s most prestigious quiz contests annually – The Sweden-India Nobel Memorial Quiz. The quiz series is part of the Sweden India Nobel Memorial Week – now in its eleventh year.
The broad theme of the quiz is Alfred Nobel and his life and achievements, the Nobel Prize, Nobel Laureates and their achievements, Sweden, its people and their culture, Swedish innovations and inventions. Members of the winning team win a week-long visit to Sweden where they will visit Swedish companies, universities and the Nobel Museum.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them for their marvellous performance and wishes them all the best for finals!

Branding And Relations Cell

Digitized medium is what students can relate to today. Internet has become the hub of video lectures, notes and educational pdf documents. Students hardly feel the urge to take the heavy books down from the shelves and do the effort to read it. We have soft copies of everything. The government of India is wise enough to promote this attitude. It has called upon the heads of all universities to get their library stuff digitised. National Digital Library is supposed to host the digitised study materials on its page. Do give a read of the link below to know how IIT Kharagpur is involved in this effort.
http://www.deccanherald.c...

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Hello!
We are pleased to announce the names of our newly selected members. We would like to extend our hearty congratulations to all of you for making it through after two gruelling rounds of selection. We feel privileged to have such an awesome pool of talent.
We, as a team, can't wait to meet you soon and work together to achieve higher goals!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-08-2017 at 10:20PM
The Scholar's Avenue

Aerial Robotics, Kharagpur (ARK) took part in its second International Aerial Robotics Competition attempt ever over the past weekend, in Beijing, after last year's debut when it was the first ever Indian team from an IIT to take part in the IARC. A total of 13 teams participated. The mission this year, the seventh mission so far, has been on the board since 2014, and wasn't completed this year as well, although one team came close. This time around, with better preparation compared to last year, ARK performed significantly better, grabbing the interest of a lot of people and nabbing the Most Innovative Design Award for their hexcopter, dubbed 'Falcon'.
The team when asked for comment, had the following words, 'We are attempting to enter a field where other countries and labs have been making optimisations in for multiple years and this gives us the opportunity to learn a lot from our peers. We're confident of a better showing at the next edition and hopefully to actually achieve the competition aim of successfully completing the multi year task.'

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-08-2017 at 10:20PM
The Scholar's Avenue

Aerial Robotics, Kharagpur (ARK) took part in its second International Aerial Robotics Competition attempt ever over the past weekend, in Beijing, after last year's debut when it was the first ever Indian team from an IIT to take part in the IARC. A total of 13 teams participated. The mission this year, the seventh mission so far, has been on the board since 2014, and wasn't completed this year as well, although one team came close. This time around, with better preparation compared to last year, ARK performed significantly better, grabbing the interest of a lot of people and nabbing the Most Innovative Design Award for their hexcopter, dubbed 'Falcon'.
The team when asked for comment, had the following words, 'We are attempting to enter a field where other countries and labs have been making optimisations in for multiple years and this gives us the opportunity to learn a lot from our peers. We're confident of a better showing at the next edition and hopefully to actually achieve the competition aim of successfully completing the multi year task'.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-08-2017 at 09:55PM

Technology Students Gymkhana

Open IIT Case Study 2017:
Presentation submission deadline: 2nd September, 3.00 AM
Email-id: tech.gymkhana@ gmail.com
Mail Subject: Case Study
File Name:

Participants need to report at least 30 minutes before their respective slots with the printed copy of the presentation.

Those who have any issue with ALIGNMENT can edit in 15 minutes and get a printed copy of the same.

Change only in the ALIGNMENT will be allowed.

Microsoft office version 2013 will be used for the presentation purpose (.ppt format).

There should not be any difference in the submitted hard copy and the soft copy.

Violation of any of the above point leads to the disqualification of the team.

For any further queries, contact
Amritash Bharadwaj - 7477785888

Applications from individuals and teams (2 or 3 members) are invited for this two-fold competition. Problem statement has already been released and the submission deadline is 3rd September.
Exciting cash prizes and opportunities for on campus internships with capillary are waiting for you. All you have to do is to register yourself or your team at skillenza’s platform to have the complete access to their learning resources and contests. Registration along with participation is completely free of cost.

Note:- Extension in deadline. The earlier deadline was 27th August which has now changed to 3rd September. Interested students don't miss the opportunity.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

#Know_Your_Professor
In this series of KYP, we are going to take you to a rather young professor who is again an alumnus of our institution- Professor Debalay Chakrabarti. He joined the Institute in 2008 and is presently an associate professor in Metallurgical and Materials Engineering Department. He is also delivering his services as the UG Co-ordinator and a member of the UGPEC, one of the institute level Senate sub-committees.

Entrepreneurship Cell

After weeks of resignation of former Uber CEO Travis Kalanick, Uber will appoint Expedia's Dara Khosrowshahi as the new CEO to steer head the global ride-hailing leviathan.
Dara Khosrowshahi will face a number of hurdles as Uber, which has raised more than $15 billion from private investors, navigates its way toward a still-unscheduled initial public offering and a high-stakes trade secrets suit filed by Alphabet's Waymo.

The Scholar's Avenue

We feel extremely sorrowful to inform the demise of Dr. Joydip Bhattacharjee. He drowned trying to save his four-year old child in Kharagpur's Golghoria area. This truly is a loss to the nation. Dr. Bhattacharjee was working in areas like water waves, wave-structure interaction and wave energy devices. He completed his Ph.D. from IIT KGP itself in the year 2008. The Scholars' Avenue extends grievances to the family of Dr. Bhattacharjee.

http://www.thestatesman.c...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 27-08-2017 at 08:23PM
The Scholar's Avenue

We feel extremely sorrowful to inform the demise of Dr. Joydeep Bhattacharya. He drowned trying to save his four-year old child in Kharagpur's Gholgeria area. This truly is a loss to the nation. Dr. Bhattacharya was working in areas like water waves, wave-structure interaction and wave energy devices. He completed his Ph.D. from IIT KGP itself in the year 2008. The Scholars' Avenue extends grievances to the family of Dr. Bhattacharya.

http://www.thestatesman.c...

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

In a news that comes as an utter shock to the entire KGP community, Prof. Joydip Bhattacharjee (Ocean Engg and Naval Architecture) is sadly no more among us. He got drowned in a large water filled ditch today while trying to rescue his 4-year-old child who had fallen into the water body near the campus. Local people took him and his son out of the water and took them to the hospital where he was declared brought dead while his son has been released after first aid. He had gone out for a ride with his son and daughter to Kharagpur's Gholgeria where the accident happened. According to witnesses, the son accidentally fell into the water and Dr. Bhattacharjee jumped in to save him.

Entire KGP community mourns the untimely loss of such a talented and beloved professor. We extended our deep condolences to his family and hope that our prayers will give them the strength to bear this huge loss.

Source: http://www.business-stand...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 27-08-2017 at 08:04PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

In a news that comes as an utter shock to the entire KGP community, Prof. Joydip Bhattacharjee (Ocean Engg and Naval Architecture) is sadly no more among us. He got drowned in a large water filled ditch today while trying to rescue his 4-year-old child who had fallen into the waterbody near the campus. Local people took him and his son out of the water and took them to the hospital where he was declared brought dead while his son has been released after first aid. He had gone out for a ride with his son and daughter to Kharagpur's Gholgeria where the accident happened. According to witnesses, the son accidentally fell into the water and Dr. Bhattacharya jumped in to save him.

Entire KGP community mourns the untimely loss of such a talented and beloved professor. All of our prayers are extended to his family and we hope that our prayers will give them the strength to bear this huge loss.

Source: http://www.business-stand...

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Khoj'17 - the annual treasure hunt event exclusively for freshers, was organized successfully in the evening yesterday by Azad Hall of Residence. In this campus wide event that was mainly about enjoyment, winning prizes, cycling long distances, getting to know the batch-mates and the serene campus - all while cracking clues after clues and searching for the right codes! Initially, it was the rain which threatened to play spoilsport but with time, the weather got better and better. About 170 teams participated with great zeal and enthusiasm along with the tinge of smile and excitement that was visible on their faces. The theme of the event was Video Games of the 90's and it surely gave freshers the moment to go back to that era and live their dream again!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 27-08-2017 at 01:13PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Khoj'17 - the annual treasure hunt event exclusively for freshers, was organized successfully in the evening yesterday by Azad Hall of Residence. In this campus wide event that was mainly about enjoyment, winning prizes, cycling long distances, getting to know the batch-mates and the serene campus - all while cracking clues after clues and searching for the right codes! Initially, it was the rain which threatened to play spoilsport but with time, the weather got better and better. More than 100 teams participated with great zeal and enthusiasm along with the tinge of smile and excitement that was visible on their faces. The theme of the event was Super Mario and it surely gave freshers the moment to go back to the 90's and live their dream again!

Technology Students Gymkhana

Hello!

GE is excited to invite you for GE Industrial Internet of Things hackathon - a private forum to encourage and recognize cool ideas that can revolutionize the IIoT. GE has bet big on the Industrial Internet — the convergence of industrial machines, data, and the Internet. We have installed sensors on gas turbines, jet engines, and other machines; connected them to the cloud; and are analyzing the resulting flow of data with an end goal to identify ways to improve machine productivity and reliability. Do you think you have the next BIG IDEA that will help us achieve our goals? Don your innovative hats and register to participate in the Hackathon! We are looking for talented developers who can build innovative solutions around IIoT, Smart City, Smart Machines, Healthcare. This hackathon is open to pre-final and final year engineering students of a select list of college (participating colleges), irrespective of the branch/ stream. Participate in this inter-collegiate hackathon and flaunt your innovative ideas!

Important dates:

Phase 1 (Idea phase) ends on 27th Aug
Phase 2 (Hackathon phase) shortlisted teams will build their application between 1st-24th Sep
Prizes:

Winning team stands a chance to win INR 1,00,000 worth gift cards and the top 3 teams stand a chance to win INR 50,000 gift cards
In addition, Top Teams stand a chance to work or Intern with GE Digital!
Happy Ideation!

For more updates visit the link: https://www.hackerearth.c...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 26-08-2017 at 05:44PM
Technology Students Gymkhana

Hello!

GE is excited to invite you for GE Industrial Internet of Things hackathon - a private forum to encourage and recognize cool ideas that can revolutionize the IIoT. GE has bet big on the Industrial Internet — the convergence of industrial machines, data, and the Internet. We have installed sensors on gas turbines, jet engines, and other machines; connected them to the cloud; and are analyzing the resulting flow of data with an end goal to identify ways to improve machine productivity and reliability. Do you think you have the next BIG IDEA that will help us achieve our goals? Don your innovative hats and register to participate in the Hackathon! We are looking for talented developers who can build innovative solutions around IIoT, Smart City, Smart Machines, Healthcare. This hackathon is open to pre-final and final year engineering students of a select list of college (participating colleges), irrespective of the branch/ stream. Participate in this inter-collegiate hackathon and flaunt your innovative ideas!

Important dates:

Phase 1 (Idea phase) ends on 27th Aug
Phase 2 (Hackathon phase) shortlisted teams will build their application between 1st-24th Sep
Prizes:

Winning team stands a chance to win INR 1,00,000 worth gift cards and the top 3 teams stand a chance to win INR 50,000 gift cards
In addition, Top Teams stand a chance to work or Intern with GE Digital!
Happy Ideation!

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

मानव संसाधन विकास मंत्रालय (भारत सरकार) ने यह निर्णय लिया है कि सभी इंजीनियरिंग कॉलेजों में प्रवेश के लिए एक संयुक्त प्रवेश परीक्षा का विचार अगले वर्ष धरातल पर नहीं उतर पायेगा | हालाँकि उन्होंने पूरे विचार को एक सिरे से खारिज नहीं किया है, बल्कि आगे इस पर चर्चा जारी रहेगी | गौरतलब हो कि ऑल इंडिया कौंसिल ऑफ़ टेक्निकल एजुकेशन ने इस वर्ष मार्च में वर्ष 2018 से इंजीनियरिंग संस्थानों में नामांकन हेतु राष्ट्रीय स्तर पर एक संयुक्त प्रवेश करवाने की बात कही थी | कौंसिल अभी भी इस विचार की संभावनाओं पर चर्चा कर रही है | ज्ञातव्य हो कि जेईई के अलावा बहुत सारे प्रदेश और निजी संस्थान स्वयं ही अपनी अपनी प्रवेश परीक्षा आयोजित करते हैं |

The HRD Ministry has decided to put the plans of introducing a common engineering entrance exam from next year on hold. Earlier, the All India Council of Technical Education (AICTE) had announced in March that a national-level common entrance examination for engineering colleges would be conducted from the next academic year in 2018. However, the idea has not been completely discarded. Apart from JEE, a number of states conduct their own tests where as several private colleges also conduct their own entrance examinations.

साभार: http://www.hindustantimes...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 26-08-2017 at 03:24PM

Technology Robotix Society


Hey Freshers!
The much awaited Robosoccer Challenge 2017 is finally here! Come, make your very own robot and cement your foothold in the world of robotics!
Date: 10:00AM
Time: 27-08-2017
Veunu: Technology Robotix Society

Entrepreneurship Cell

After the resignation of Vishal Sikka from Infosys, Nandan Nilekani has been appointed as the non-executive Chairman of the Board.
This appointment is being seen as the best choice for Infosys for the coming days, after years of internal management bouts plaguing the company. Hopefully, Nandan Nilekani will be able to steer Infosys to a position of former strength until a new CEO is appointed in the next financial year.

The Scholar's Avenue

A campus and its vibrancy is visible not just by how active its students are or how beautiful the campus is, but also how the students choose to use their creativity to make their halls a home, or the campus, their playground.
Our friends over at the Department of Architecture and Regional Planning have worked on a project on utilising Alternative Spaces in the campus better to help foster a stronger community spirit.
The project, titled, 'Happiness Project - What made me' works as follows. Four coloured threads, symbolising what made you happy(yellow), angry(red), think(green) and change(blue) have been provided, and all you have to do is connect the most relevant words.The instructions to use this creative mapping technique is provided along with.
Do visit the space adjoining ARP and Bio-Technology Department and mark in your threads too. :)
We at The Scholars' Avenue visited after hearing about it and in the short time that had passed between us hearing about it and us actually visiting it, some patterns had already begun to emerge.
Follow the pictures for our first thoughts:

  • View the post
  • Posted on 24-08-2017 at 06:58PM
The Scholar's Avenue

A campus and its vibrancy is visible not just by how active its students are or how beautiful the campus is, but also how the students choose to use their creativity to make their halls a home, or the campus, their playground.
Our friends over at the Department of Architecture and Regional Planning have worked on a project on utilising Alternative Spaces in the campus better to help foster a stronger community spirit.
The project, titled, 'Happiness Project - What made me' works as follows. Four coloured threads, symbolising what made you happy(yellow), angry(red), think(green) and change(blue) have been provided, and all you have to do is connect the most relevant words.The instructions to use this creative mapping technique is provided along with.
Do visit the space adjoining ARP and Bio-Technology Department and mark in your threads too. :)
We at The Scholars' Avenue visited after hearing about it and in the short time that had passed between us hearing about it and us actually visiting it, some patterns had already begun to emerge.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The entrance examination for the prestigious Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) i.e., JEE Advanced will go completely online from 2018. Joint Admission Board (JAB), which is the policymaking body on IIT admissions, took this decision in a meeting on 20th August.
IIT Madras director and JAB 2017 chairman Prof. Bhaskar Ramamurthi said in a statement, “It has been decided that the JEE (Advanced) will be conducted in online mode from 2018 onwards. Further information regarding the examination will be provided by the JAB in due course.”
The HRD ministry had earlier introduced the option of taking the JEE Mains online. However, out of 13 lakh students who took the JEE Mains this year, less than 10% of them opted for online mode.

Source: http://economictimes.indi...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 24-08-2017 at 04:58PM

The Scholar's Avenue

One of the main water source lines to KGP had a breach on the 22nd of August resulting in the cutoff of water supply to halls for maintenance work. The halls which had backup did not face any problem but some halls like MT and LBS got an intermittent supply of water, or sometimes no supply at all for long periods.

The problem has been rectified as of now and the water supply is ongoing again, but it would take sometime to regain normalcy.

We request everybody to use water judiciously.

  • Posted on 24-08-2017 at 09:39AM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Anthill Creations, founded by five IIT Kharagpur alumni Nancy Charaya(ex-Chief Editor, Awaaz), Pooja Rai, Nupur Agrawal, Souradeep Paul and Vishesh Gupta (all 2015 - B.Arch.), is one of the eight early-stage non-profit startups selected for an 18-month incubation program by the NS Raghavan Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning (NSRCEL) at the Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Bangalore. The founders will also receive fellowship support of 18 lakh.
This is part of India's first-ever, non-profit startup incubator supported by the Michael and Susan Dell Foundation. The selected organizations are tackling some of the toughest challenges in education and skills among poor communities around the country.
Anthill Creations aims to build sustainable playscapes for children by using recyclable materials. The idea of Anthill Creations is to create the world where communities come together and active play becomes affordable and accessible to all. It works towards lighter, quicker and cheaper transformation of dead zones into interactive and sustainable playscapes from scrap tyres and recycled material by mobilizing the communities. Recycling non-biodegradable material like tyres, therefore, would not just help safeguard the environment but be cost effective as a building material too.
“Traditionally, mass produced recreational equipment for building a playground would cost a very high price, but since we are using material that is considered trash by some, we have been successful in setting up playgrounds for very cheap cost,” Souradeep had said in an interview.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-08-2017 at 08:45PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Anthill Creations, founded by five IIT Kharagpur alumni Nancy Charaya, Pooja Rai, Nupur Agrawal, Souradeep Paul and Vishesh Gupta (all 2015 - B.Arch.), is one of the eight early-stage non-profit startups selected for an 18-month incubation program by the NS Raghavan Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning (NSRCEL) at the Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Bangalore. The founders will also receive fellowship support of 18 lakh.
This is part of India's first-ever, non-profit startup incubator supported by the Michael and Susan Dell Foundation. The selected organizations are tackling some of the toughest challenges in education and skills among poor communities around the country.
Anthill Creations aims to build sustainable playscapes for children by using recyclable materials. The idea of Anthill Creations is to create the world where communities come together and active play becomes affordable and accessible to all. It works towards lighter, quicker and cheaper transformation of dead zones into interactive and sustainable playscapes from scrap tyres and recycled material by mobilizing the communities. Recycling non-biodegradable material like tyres, therefore, would not just help safeguard the environment but be cost effective as a building material too.
“Traditionally, mass produced recreational equipment for building a playground would cost a minimum of Rs. 2 lakh, but since we are using material that is considered trash by some, we have been successful in setting up playgrounds for just Rs. 20,000,” Souradeep had said in an interview.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-08-2017 at 08:22PM

The Scholar's Avenue

Hello all,

Like earlier years Placement Committee [Core Committee] will be formed to assist the Career Development Centre for better placements of students.

The students eligible are : 3rd year Dual Degree / 3rd Year Integrated M.Sc. / 1st Year M. Tech./ 1st year M.Sc.(2-year) students from all Departments / Centres / Schools.

Interested students from the above courses are advised to submit the filled Application Form (specified form has been mailed by the VP)

The application form should be signed by the candidate and routed through the Placement In-charge of the Department / Centre / School and the same should reach the CDC Office positively by 12.00 Noon on 29th August 2017(TUESDAY).

NO applications will be accepted after the deadline under any circumstances.
While submitting the applications, the applicants should enter their name / roll number / with signature in a list available with the CDC.

Selections will be made based on a test of business communication skills followed by personal interviews. The detailed schedule is given below.

Application submission : 29th August 2017(TUESDAY) by 12.00 Noon to CDC Office
Selection Process : will be notified later

Looking forward for an active participation.

  • Posted on 22-08-2017 at 08:13PM

The Scholar's Avenue

The CV module has been the center of much frustration during placements 2016. Things have drastically improved since, but several students still found the process painful and annoying. What was your experience like?

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

With an aim to teach students the basic life science techniques, IIT Kharagpur is going to start Genomics Laboratory that would be first of its kind in India. The primary objective of the laboratory would be to teach all the students at the second year the basic techniques of life sciences that would include microscopy-based observation, molecular biology, protein structure and function and lastly, bioinformatics. Under the mentorship of faculties, from third year onwards, students would be allowed to plan and execute experiments by their own. The lab and its equipment for research would be available for the students for 24×7.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-08-2017 at 05:37PM

Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society

We welcome the new members of our Society. We saw an overload of submissions for 'People beautiful from the inside.' :)

Akshay Choudhary ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍ ‍‍‍‍‍‍ ‍‍16CE10006

Alumni Cell

"Know Your Alumni"-E2:
Students' Alumni Cell presents its new series 'Know Your Alumni' where it will bring up interviews, blogs and posts about the extraordinary alumni of IIT Kharagpur to you every week.

In E-2, we have Dr. Arun Kumar Bhaduri, now the Director of Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic Research. He discusses in detail about his stay in KGP, his tenure as the Hall President of RK Hall and as the G.Sec Sports as well. Notably he talks about the need for us KGPians to actively look into research and academia as career choices.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Prasanna Shrivastava, an IIT Kharagpur alumnus (Mechanical Engineering, 2005-09), has written this brilliant article in which he discusses various issues regarding what IITians do after graduation and has focused on certain myths as well. He ponders over various aspects backed with analysis of his own batch and in the process, breaks a few myths regarding IITians. It gives an insight to brain drain, the correlation between CGPA and entrepreneurial skills, IITians pursuing higher education, various roles through which they are contributing to the society etc.
Give it a read - https://www.linkedin.com/...

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Open IIT Road Race was held today in the morning. Around 120 participants participated in the race (around 100 boys and 20 girls). Previous records were broken in the Men category.
Results are as follow -
5km Road Race (Men):
1st - Manish Singh Rana - 16min 24 sec
2nd - Aniruddha Patel - 16min 28 sec
3rd - Rampal Barjati - 17min
4th - Narendra Kumar Khichar - 17min 35 sec

2.2km Road Race (Women)
1st - Krishnapriya Kantipudi - 10min 23 sec
2nd - Prachi Agrawal - 10min 25 sec
3rd - Raksha Biseni - 10min 46 sec
4th - Mahima Karumanchi - 11min 04 sec

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners!

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

In an unprecedented move, the Central government will provide Rs 70,000 as a monthly fellowship to those researchers doing their PhDs in IITs or IISc for a period of five years. At the 67th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur, Union higher education secretary Kewal Kumar Sharma said, “As part of the research fellowship scheme of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, we wish the meritorious students who are being forced to leave the country for purely financial reasons stay within the country. We will provide 2,000 such monthly fellowships across the IIT system and IISc Bengaluru. The cabinet nod for the proposal should come soon. We are hopeful to start it from the next session,”
Presently researcher-students get Rs 25,000 as monthly scholarship at IITs.

We believe that this will financially empower students having a keen interest in research to continue their work without being forced to opt for lucrative corporate jobs for higher pay.

Source: http://www.dnaindia.com/i...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 20-08-2017 at 11:00AM

The Scholar's Avenue

The Scholars' Avenue shared Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society, IIT Kharagpur - TFPS's album.

Our beloved IITKGP turned 67 today.

On this occasion, to show his love towards the campus and the amazing way it functions, Lokesh Deshmukh conceived the idea of The Portrait Project and Suraj Iyyengar executed it.

What a better day than the institute-foundation day to show the massive love and respect we have for the 'dadas' of the campus who have laid the foundation to the kgp culture and student life.

Here is a small effort towards recognising such people who're as much kgpians as we are (probably more). The list is in no way exhaustive and its just the beginning. Many more in store.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 19-08-2017 at 06:30PM
Spring Fest

Next in line, we introduce Riya Rastogi from Dyal Singh College, New Delhi and Best Campus Ambassador for Northern India.

Here's what she says about her experience-
"I have been a part of SF for the last two years and it has always been a memorable journey for me and my team.
Chosen as a CA built a responsibility for keeping the team together. Full day hard work in competitions, fun in the star-nights and long night walks were the best moments for us.
The hospitality provided by SF team and freedom allowed by IIT KGP administration just adds up to the fun.The time we spent there has always been the best memories that remind us of the bond we have as a team."

  • View the post
  • Posted on 19-08-2017 at 05:54PM

Kharagpur Open Source Society

Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared a group.

We have made a group for our python classes so that you all can post your doubts, interact with mentors, other students and help yourself in learning python.

We strongly believe that a healthy interaction is necessary in the learning process and thus we encourage you to keep posting there.

We will be posting important details regarding our classes on the group so make sure you follow it and be updated.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 19-08-2017 at 04:02PM
Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society

Our beloved IITKGP turned 67 today.

On this occasion, to show his love towards the campus and the amazing way it functions, Lokesh Deshmukh conceived the idea of The Portrait Project and Suraj Iyyengar executed it.

What a better day than the institute-foundation day to show the massive love and respect we have for the 'dadas' of the campus who have laid the foundation to the kgp culture and student life.

Here is a small effort towards recognising such people who're as much kgpians as we are (probably more). The list is in no way exhaustive and its just the beginning. Many more in store.

Doubts kill more dreams than failure ever will."

Be there!

The Scholar's Avenue

IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have agreed on institutional collaboration in education, research and outreach programmes in the field of interdisciplinary medical research.

"Plans are underway for joint research programmes with external funding. Exchange programmes will be promoted through creation of visiting faculty, scientist positions with access to laboratory facilities for joint research and exchange of data," said Prof Suman Chakraborty, Mechanical Engineering faculty and programme coordinator from IIT Kharagpur.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 19-08-2017 at 10:39AM
The Scholar's Avenue

As conveyed by Professor P.P. Chakrabarti, on the ocassion of the institute's 67th Foundation Day, IIT Kharagpur is gearing up to open a Centre of Excellence for research on Artificial Intelligence.

"Two Centres are being planned. One on AI research and one for extension of science and heritage part (the Sandhi science-culture initiative). Alumni is organising support for developing these two areas," IIT Kharagpur Director P.P. Chakrabarti said here during the institute's 67th Foundation Day.

"It will also get linked with the supercomputing facility, cloud computing etc. Additionally we want to do some really good projects in climate change and AI, big projects on healthcare and AI so that will require augmented funds," he said.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 19-08-2017 at 06:24AM

Spring Fest

Introducing the Best Campus Ambassadors of Spring Fest 2017.
Here's what Harshal Garg, Best CA for Central India had to say about his experience-
"Spring Fest is absolutely justified as one of the best cultural fests of India and this year was no exception. I, along with 60 of my friends, had a great time and a wonderful journey.

Everything from management and competitions to the concerts was worthy of appreciation. All the coordinators were helpful and professional.

The campus itself is beautiful and the cleanliness is something to behold. Looking forward to visit again."

International Relations Cell

On this auspicious occasion of the 67th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur, we convey our best wishes to every Kgpian across the world. In 66 years we came this far. We believe IIT Kharagpur will continue to inspire each and every one for all the glorious years ahead and play a constructive role in building a new and strong India. 66 years till now, in our hearts forever <3

  • View the post
  • Posted on 18-08-2017 at 06:00PM
Kshitij

The late night bhaat sessions over a cup of hot tea, the food joints and canteens that are a lifeline for the 'gourmand', the 2.2 rounds, the incessant cramming before the exams and the subsequent collective groan at the unfortunate results, all have been a source of countless indelible memories for all KGPians.

This 18th August, Kshitij pays a heartwarming tribute to the place that has and will shape our future. Happy Birthday, KGP!

#hbdkgp

  • View the post
  • Posted on 18-08-2017 at 05:28PM
Technology Students Gymkhana

SPECTRA, IIT Kharagpur invites all the budding artists, hobbyists and aspiring cartoonists to come and join us on a beautiful journey - a workshop on CARTOONING AND CARICATURE DESIGN.

They're gonna discuss a lot - from basics to technical intricacies of character design in the 2 hour workshop.
Do attend the workshop to give flight to your imagination and have lots and lots of fun.

Many surprises lie ahead 😉

See you on 19th August 4pm -6pm. Please respect everyone's time so you don't miss anything.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The seed that was sown several years ago has now taken the shape of a full-fledged tree which has borne countless sweet fruits till now and dazzled the entire world with its aura. We hope that IIT Kharagpur will continue to progress on the path of success and achievement.
We wish IIT Kharagpur a happy 67th Foundation Day!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 18-08-2017 at 02:45PM
Gopali Youth Welfare Society

Jagriti Vidya Mandir, the flagship initiative of GYWS, started in 2008 now houses over 200 underpreviliged students, most of whom receive free of cost education from Nursery to Class 5.
This has not just been a place for development but also an inspiration for each member and the society at large to be a part of the noble initiatives we put forward.
We are proud to present you a jest of JVM!

#jvm #gyws #kids #education #future #success #initiative #development

Kharagpur Open Source Society


KOSS brings to you its series of Python Classes, an effort to bring out the developer in you. Learn how to code in Python, by starting from the basics, and having a proper hands-one experience in building software. No prior experience in programming is required. As long as you are enthusiastic enough to learn, things will go smooth! ;)
Date: 03:30PM
Time: 19-08-2017
Veunu: Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS

  • View the post
  • Posted on 17-08-2017 at 08:58PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

In an initiative of its own kind, “Staff Excellency Awards” were awarded to some of the staff members in Azad Hall of Residence on the eve of Independence Day for their exemplary service. Amongst the awardees, one was the Mess Supervisor who has been discharging his duty with discipline and commitment for several years. Even though his daily official work starts around 5.30 am, he has seldom been late. Another, a mess worker who lives 25 kilometers away from the campus, works till late in the night to clean the plates and has seldom been absent.
In an another good gesture, plantation drive was also organized on this eve and wardens of the same hall planted trees in the hall premises to send out the message regarding the dire need of planting more and more trees.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 17-08-2017 at 08:35PM

Kharagpur Open Source Society

"Everyone should learn how to program a computer, because it teaches you how to think." - Steve Jobs ;)

Like every other semester, let's once again dive into the world of learning something new. This time, KOSS brings to you its series of Python Classes, an effort to bring out the developer in you. Learn how to code in Python, by starting from the basics, and having a proper hands-on experience in building software. No prior experience in programming is required. As long as you are enthusiastic enough to learn, things will go smooth! ;)

Fill up this form [1], if you are interested in attending the classes. Everyone should have their laptops (fully charged, since providing power supply won't be possible), and have Python installed on them. You can download Python from here [2]. More resources will be mailed to you, once you have filled up the form.

See you all!

Venue: CS 120, CS Department
Time: 3:30 pm - 5:30 pm
Date: Saturday, 19th Aug

[1]: https://tinyurl.com/kossp...

[2]: https://www.python.org/do...

  • Posted on 17-08-2017 at 08:11PM

Technology Students Gymkhana

Last opportunity for all.!
Pursuing an MS from the top US and Canadian Universities is usually on the top of every undergraduate student's future plans. Mr Samudranil Chatterjee, Founder Mentor at Educidate, will host a workshop to educate the students about the nuances of the application procedure from GRE to the SOP. This workshop is brought to you by Educidate in association with Career Development Centre.

Date: 19th August, 2017
Time: 9am to 6pm.
Venue: SN Bose Auditorium

All the interested students need to register their names to Madhumita ma'am in the CDC Office by 18th August,2017.

Student Welfare Group

Attention Freshers!
Student Welfare Group brings you the opportunity to know more about the Student Mentor Program. The objective of this programme is to help the First years understand the various aspects of college life, and adapt accordingly under the mentorship of experienced seniors.
An interactive session of all the First-Year Undergraduate Students with the SWG Team will be held on 17th August, Thursday at Vikramshila (V2) as per the following slot:
6:30 PM – AE, CE, CH, CS, EC, HS, IE, MA, MF, ME, NA & PH
8:00 PM – AG, AR, BT, CY, EE, EX, GG, IM, MT, MI & QD

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Prof. William Kumar Mohanty has been appointed as the new President of Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur. He joined the Institute in 2003 and has been serving as Professor in the Department of Geology & Geophysics.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for the same and wishes him all the best for his tenure.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 15-08-2017 at 08:45PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Prof. William Kumar Mohanty has been appointed as the new President of Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur. He joined the Institute in 2003 and has been serving as assistant professor at the Department of Geology & Geophysics.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for the same and wishes him all the best for his tenure.

Kshitij

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a happy Independence Day.
Along with flag hoisting and conducting cultural programmes, let's also remember and respect the sacrifices made by the freedom fighters. Although we have achieved autonomy, yet we are to free our country from poverty, religious tensions and racism.

This Independence Day, let's join our hands together and pledge to maintain the sanctity of this country for perpetuity. Let's play our part in nation-building and make India a manufacturing hub, thereby promoting Make In India.

Design Credits: Shubham Kumar

  • Posted on 15-08-2017 at 02:52PM

Technology Students Gymkhana

Your intangible assets might be of greater value than you realize! How well do you know about your right to protect your own creations of mind?
Do attend the “IPR Workshop: How Intellectual Property impacts life?” on 19th August 2017, 9 a.m. onwards at the Maitrayee Auditorium to know more about the legal rights you hold over the fruits of your intellect.
The sessions will be conducted by the likes of Hon'ble Justice S. Ravindra Bhatt, Prof. V. C. Vivekanandan, Hon'ble Justice Aniruddha Bose, Prof. Imtiaz Gulam Ahmed and Mr. Vineet Rohilla. Each session will be followed by an interactive Q & A session with the speakers.
Safeguard your intellectual properties. Don’t miss out.
Register yourself at tinyurl.com/IPRWorkshop17...
Hurry! Limited seats are available.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 15-08-2017 at 02:19PM

All students from 1st year UG till Ph.D. are eligible.
Theme: “Next generation Energy and Transportation solutions” with special focus on: Artificial Intelligence | Cyber Security | New Materials.

M N Faruqui Innovations Centre is organizing a workshop, where a representative from KPIT Technologies, Dr. Somnath Sengupta would be present on 21st August,2017. All the enthusiasts are requested to start working on their ideas so that it can be discussed over there. Then venue will be intimidated later.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

In the series of articles under 'Jewels of KGP', we introduce you all to Mr. Sikhar Patranabis who did his graduation in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Kharagpur (2011-15) and graduated with a staggering CGPA of 9.87 which also fetched him the President of India Gold Medal for the year 2015. The lure of a high-paying pre-placement job offer from Microsoft, however, could not distract him away from his passion for research. He is an IBM PhD Fellow at the Secured Embedded Architecture Laboratory, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur and currently pursuing his PhD under the supervision of Dr. Debdeep Mukhopadhyay.
In this interview, he talks about his KGP life, secret of his stellar academic performance, internship experiences, passion for research and much more about such things.
Give it a read...

http://awaaziitkgp.org/si...

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Wanted to know how much CGPA does it take to get your branch changed at the end of the first year? Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur brings to you an extensive analysis of the Department Change statistics for the batch of 2016-17. DepC is one of the major goals for the first years who don't get their desired branch on the basis of JEE rank. The analysis consists of CGPA cut off for different branches, the number of students outgoing and incoming to a particular branch, comparison of cut offs for the year 2016 and 2017.
A total of 110 students got their branch changed this year. As expected, the cut off was highest for CSE i.e., 9.73. Read the full analysis here:
http://awaaziitkgp.org/in...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 11-08-2017 at 06:58PM

Entrepreneurship Cell

Softbank invests a huge amount of capital in Flipkart, reported to be atleast $2.5 Billion dollars. With this funding round, Flipkart now has about $ 4 Billion extra on its balance sheet.
This is the biggest investment ever in the Indian E-commerce ecosystem. With this round, Flipkart has now raised more than $6 billion in cash since starting out in 2007!

Technology Literary Society

कुछ सपनें हकीकत बन जाते हैं, तो कुछ सपनें ही बन कर रह जाते हैं | आँखें बंद करके तो हर कोई सपना देखता है पर खुली आँखों से जो सपनें देखते हैं उनकी बात ही कुछ और होती है | सपनें देखना अच्छी बात है पर मेहनत करके उसे पूरा करना और भी अच्छी बात |

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-08-2017 at 09:10PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Thirteen students from the Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group (KRSSG) team represented the institute in the recently concluded RoboCup held in Nagoya (Japan). For qualification, they had submitted a video in the month of February and qualified for the final event.
RoboCup is an annual international robotics competition proposed and founded in 1997 with the aim of promoting robotics and AI research, by offering a publicly appealing, but formidable challenge. This year RoboCup was held in Nagoya, Japan. They participated in two leagues in RoboCup - Small Sized League and Humanoid Simulation League.
This year, it was their first participation in the Small Sized League and they faced a lot of technical difficulties. A total of twenty-four teams had qualified for the league, out of which only twenty could finally make it to the league. The twenty teams were divided into four groups. From each group, first two teams on the basis of performance were selected for the quarter finals. Unfortunately, they couldn’t make it to the quarters.
In the humanoid simulation league, it was their second participation. They stood 8th among 13 teams. They were able to defeat 5 different teams in one to one matches. They won a total of 7 matches, drew 3 and were in the quarter finals. They missed the chance to go to the semi finals by just one match!
Next year, the RoboCup will be held in Montreal, Canada. We hope for a better performance and even better results in the upcoming RoboCup.
Link to Competition website: https://www.robocup2017.o... /

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team for their stupendous efforts and commendable performance! They have surely made us all proud by putting IIT Kharagpur on RoboSoccer's world map.

(In the picture, Team KRSSG is with the Team Tigers Mannheim in Small Sized League Competition)

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-08-2017 at 08:08PM

The Scholar's Avenue

Hola Freshers!

We hope you have started to settle into the daily bustle of the campus. In the past week you might have been glued to the notice boards of your halls, or rather they would have been glued with posters introducing a multitude of different societies and groups. Every society puts up a great effort just to capture a part of that board space, to ultimately capture your eye and even more to sell themselves to you later on. Before any narcissism creeps in, we would like to point out the importance of the existence of this plethora of opportunities out there. For starters, the sheer number of these societies is what differentiates KGP from the rest of the IITs. Topping that, over time, each of these societies have turned into hubs of creativity, intellectual might, cutting-edge research, sources of valuable insights and more than anything else, a great place to make friends and forge bonds that last forever.

Hence we would like to bring to your notice a little project we did. Presenting the Periodic Table of KGPian Societies, an interactive compilation of all known societies in our campus so that you at least have a brief idea of what to expect in the coming days, make your choices wisely and play your cards right, both intellectually and socially.

https://thescholarsavenue...

P.S: Any societies that need any edits in their respective sections can ping us, or mail us (thescholarsavenue@ gmail.com ) with the edits.
We have only accounted groups that are open to all and are not limited by the Departments and we agree that we might have missed a few nevertheless.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-08-2017 at 08:47PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Remember the announcement of getting the synthetic track built in Jnan Ghosh Stadium one and half years ago? Plans have been chalked out, the timeline has been rescheduled again and again, but we are yet to see even the first glimpse of any kind of construction work out there. In the series of articles under the column "Your Perspective", we would like to introduce you to the thoughts of a 5th year KGPian who feels that the delay in construction of synthetic track is dampening the spirit of athletes. And now that KGPians have performed brilliantly in sports fests and meets including the recent one in 67th West Bengal State Annual Athletics Meet, "IIT Kharagpur needs the synthetic track more now than ever!"

In case you wish to express your thoughts on a particular topic related to the campus, email them to awaazofiitkgp@ gmail.com with the subject as "Your Perspective".
http://awaaziitkgp.org/pe...

  • Posted on 08-08-2017 at 07:47PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Attention 3rd year students:

Honda Foundation has announced the Honda Young Engineer & Scientist (Y-E-S) Award 2017.

The program is open for applications w.e.f. August 01st, 2017, and will remain accessible for on-line applications through the portal http://yes.honda.co.in / upto August 31st, 2017.

Students who are currently studying in the fifth semester of their 4-year (B.Tech.) or 5-year dual degree (M. Tech.) programs are eligible to apply. Other details of the Award, eligibility criteria, application schedules and the application process will be discussed in the Information Seminar by Mrs. Jyoti Bhatia, Asst. Manager, Honda Motor India Prvt Ltd.

Date - 8th August
Time - 5 PM - 6 PM
Venue - NR 122

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-08-2017 at 08:45PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Fourteen alumni of IIT Kharagpur were conferred with the Distinguished Alumnus Award at the 63rd Convocation for their outstanding achievements and contribution to their respective fields. They are:

1) Anuradha Acharya - M.Sc. Physics (1995), the founder and CEO of Mapmygenome (molecular diagnostic company), founder and ex-CEO of Ocimum Bio Solutions (genomics outsourcing company), awarded Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum in 2011.

2) Sanghamitra Bandyopadhyay - M.Tech. Computer Science and Engineering (1994), Director of the Indian Statistical Institute, computer scientist specializing in computational biology, Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize winner in Engineering Science (2010).

3) Sujit Banerji - B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering (1960), M.Tech. Industrial Engineering (1962), Professor of Operations Management at Warwick Manufacturing Group (University of Warwick), bestowed with Glory of India Award by the India International Friendship Society (2010).

4) Deepak Basu - B.Sc. Physics (1968) and B.Tech. Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering (1971), a social entrepreneur, founder and chairman of Anudeep Foundation, received NASSCOM Social Innovation Honors award in 2012.

5) Arun Kumar Bhaduri - B.Tech. (1983) and Ph.D. (1992) both in Metallurgical and Material Science Engineering, Director of Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic Research, a distinguished scientist.

6) Subhasis Chaudhuri - B.Tech. Electronics and Electrical Communication (1985), leading expert in Image Processing and Computer Vision, professor at the department of Electrical Engineering at IIT Bombay, recipient of Dr. Vikram Sarabhai Research Award (2001) as well as Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize in Engineering Sciences (2004).

7) Raj Kamal Jha - B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering (1988), Chief Editor of The Indian Express, one of the finest journalist of India and internationally acclaimed novelist.

8) Surajit Kar Purkayastha - B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering (1978), an IPS officer and currently Director General of Police (DGP) of West Bengal.

9) Dr Brajendra Mishra - B.Tech. Metallurgical and Materials Engineering (1981), Kenneth G. Merriam Distinguished Professor of Mechanical Engineering and Assoc. Director of the Metal Processing Institute at the Worcester Polytechnic Institute, Director of the National Science Foundation’s Industry/University Collaborative Research Center on Resource Recovery & Recycling

10) RAdm Shekhar Mittal - M.Tech. Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering (1985), current chairman and managing director of the defence PSU Goa Shipyard Limited, specialist in fleet maintenance, weapon engineering and the intricacies of surface and submarine design.

11) Aneesh Reddy - B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering (2006), Co-Founder & CEO at Capillary Technologies.

12) Anand Sen - B.Tech. Metallurgical Engineering (1981), ex-chief of Marketing & sales - Flat Products. current Vice President at Flat Products & TQM, awarded Essar Gold Medal by Indian Institute of Metals (2004).

13) Dr Ruma Acharya - M.Tech. Chemical Engineering (1973), an eminent Indian-American entrepreneur and philanthropist, founder of Grounded Technologies Inc.

14) Amitabha Ghosh - Msc. Geology and Geophysics (1993), Chairman, Science Operations Working Group -- Mission Operations at the NASA Mars Exploration Rover Mission, was the only Asian on NASA's Mars Pathfinder mission, recipient of NASA Mars Pathfinder Achievement Award in 1997 and the NASA Mars Exploration Rover Achievement Award in 2004.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them and wishes them best for their future endeavours!

  • View the post

CSURG hopes to continue working with more undergraduates, and looks forward to growing participation.

Hello IIT-Kharagpur Alumni,
Unfortunately I am writing a public message since my messages to the alumni cell went completely answered.
I would like to request anyone who knows anyone from the MTech 1982 bacth, specifically from agricultural machinery or related fields, to please get in touch with me. My father, Late Udai Kumar Singh, who passed away in 1988 was an IIT-KGP alumni and I would love to speak to anyone who knew about him.
Please feel free to message me. I am really looking forward to any responses or leads.
Sincerely,
Shreya

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

सही ही कहा गया है, "You can take a KGPian out of KGP, but you can not take KGP out of a KGPian!" यह सांझ उषा का आँगन, आलिंगन विरह मिलन का | जहाँ मिलन है, वहां विरह भी स्वाभाविक है | आखिर वह भावुक क्षण आ ही गया जब हम इस KGP परिवार के अभिन्न अंग बनकर इससे बिछड़ रहे हैं | चार-पांच सालों के इस सफर में यादों का कारवां अपने आप बनता चला गया और न जाने कब हम इसके इतने करीब हो गए कि आज KGP से बिछड़ने पर चाह कर भी ह्रदय सब्र नहीं कर पा रहा | इल्लू के दीयों से लेकर टेम्पो शाउट तक | स्मृतियों का बाँध अब टूट पड़ा है | कितनी ही कड़वी मीठी खट्टी यादें - जिंदगी के चॉकलेट्स सी | इन्हीं भावनाओं को शब्दों में पिरोने की कोशिश की है 'आवाज़' ने | तो आप भी रूबरू होइए हमारे पासिंग आउट सीनियर्स की भावनाओं से, स्मृतियों से | झांकिए उनकी यादों के गलियारों में | प्रस्तुत है यादें...

Communiqué

UG first year Induction Program and Communiqué present a certified course on Effective Communication Sessions by Dr. Ranbir Sinha. Dr. Sinha is a rocket scientist, an inventor, and an educator. He received his Bachelor of Technology degree in Aerospace Engineering from IIT Kharagpur, India and achieved the top merit position in the graduating class. Dr Sinha is fluent in 4 languages: English, Hindi, Bengali, and German.

The sessions will be held from 7th to 11th of August. Former to these sessions, all the students are required to give a quick test to gauge their fluency and pronunciation through the link given below. This test also helps you identify the mistakes in your speech and helps you improve your communication. Students who score below 60% in this test are required to attend this course, those above 60% are also welcome for the same.

Link to the test: http://communique.iitkgp.... /

The link is only accessible on a Chrome browser. Please sign up before proceeding to the test and read all the instructions carefully. The deadline for this test is 10:00 PM on 6th August. Do attempt it before the same.

Eligibility: UG & PG first years
Date: 7th to 11th August
Time: 6:00 to 8:00 PM
Venue: V2 (7th & 8th August) | V3 (9th-11th August)

Branding And Relations Cell

Hello!

Greetings from The Finance & Investment Cell, St. Stephen's College.​!

The Finance & Investment Cell of St. Stephen's College is proud to present and invite you to it's unique and exciting case solving competition, CASE CLUB LEAGUE.

We would like to invite your college to take part in one of the most prestigious case solving competitions. Please do circulate the same to the students in your college!

The Case Club League is going to land you up in tough situations and throw challenges at you that will take meticulous thinking and test your ability to resolve issues, negotiate and outsmart some of the best in the business.

A brief overview of the structure of the competition is as follows:

Participation in teams up to 3 members (lone wolves are allowed). Cross- college teams are allowed. Students from colleges outside Delhi University can also participate.

It comprises of three rounds. The first round will be online, focusing on interactive corporate case studies and held over two days, 11th and 12thAugust.

Slots for participation are:
11th August (online): 6 PM to 9 PM
12th August (online): 10 PM to 1 AM

The second round will also be online and the third round will be held at St. Stephen’s College. The second round will be based on excel modelling where you will be tested on your creativity and innovation, while the third round will be a surprise round. We will make changes in the final round for the outstation teams who make it to the finals.

With some exciting prizes at stake, this year's edition is all set to be bigger and better! Come try the first ever midnight interactive case study competition at Delhi University!

REGISTER NOW (deadline 10th August): http://tinyurl.com/casecl...

For more information, keep checking our Facebook page :-
https://www.facebook.com/...

In case of any queries contact:

Pragati : +91-9538767691
Naren : +91-9997980999
Muskan : +91-9205741198

Or mail us at caseclubleague2017.ssc@ gmail.com

Regards
The Case Club League Team
(F&IC, St. Stephen's College)

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

For the first time in the sports history of IIT Kharagpur, our team participated in the West Bengal State Sports Meet held in Salt Lake Stadium, Kolkata. In the 67th edition of State Sports Meet which was held on 29th June to 1st July, a team of 6 students represented IIT Kharagpur and performed remarkably well.
Abin Devassia finished fourth in Discus Throw with a heave of astounding 37.25 metres. He also had 11.68 metres to his name in Shot put. Dimple Kapadia clocked 14 seconds in 100 metres and jumped 4.16 metres in Long Jump. Utsav Mazumder clocked a brilliant 11.9 seconds in 100 metres. Sairam Alla, a seasoned campaigner, took a mere 23.6 seconds in 200 metres. The credit for this marvellous performance and beginning of a new chapter in KGP's sports history goes to the coach Mr. Pranab Sarkar as well.
Abin Devassia who hails from Wayanad (Kerala), a 3rd year student of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture, is associated with Discuss Throw as he prefers field events. With only a mere practice of 2 months, he has a record of throwing 37.22 metres which in itself is a great accomplishment.
Korabu Dimple Kapadia, a student of Agriculture and Food Engineering, is a 100 metres sprinter. Hailing from Vizag, she comes from a family which has been associated with sports. This 3rd year student has been associated with sports from a tender age of 5.
Utsav Mazumdar, a student of Agriculture and Food Engineering, who hails from Jamshedpur is a 100 metres sprinter.
Sairam Alla, a 5th year student of Computer Science and Engineering, hails from Vizag and primarily takes part in 200 m and 400 m.

Source: https://www.telegraphindi...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the team members and the coach for their exemplary performance!

  • Posted on 01-08-2017 at 08:40PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

A team of students from IIT Kharagpur, headed by Prof. Aurobinda Routray at the Department of Electrical Engineering, have created a device named Smart Hygiene Monitor (SHM) that helps in reducing the use of water, harmful cleaning agents and even manpower by alerting authorities about the need to clean an area (toilets, eateries, hospitals, parks, airports, railway stations) only when needed.
The Smart Hygiene Monitor (SHM) records levels of ammonia, sulphur dioxide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, volatile organic compounds and particulate matter through sensors and sends online alerts to stakeholders when a certain threshold is crossed. It can be installed at any place where cleanliness needs to be monitored at regular intervals. At present, these public facilities are generally cleaned at fixed intervals, irrespective of how dirty they are.
The device has been developed using an embedded platform incorporated with sensors that are connected via the Internet of Things (IoT). “This monitor using sensors detects the level of hygiene in a room and through cloud sends data to the stakeholders,” Prof. Routray said, adding that the setup cost for a 20-sq ft area would be less than Rs 5,000.

Source: http://m.economictimes.co...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team for their accomplishment!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-08-2017 at 02:27PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.

An IIT Kharagpur Song on our motto 'Yogah Karmasu Kaushalam'

This was composed by scientist, poet and Distinguished Alum, Shri (Dr) Shantanu Mohapatra.

https://www.facebook.com/...

Here is an attempted English Transliteration

An IIT Kharagpur Song (Composed by Dr Shantanu Mohapatra)

Yogah Karmasu Kaushalam.
Naya Kadam Badhaye Hain,
Sath Hi Chalenge Ham.

'Sa Vidya Vimuktaye' Ka
Lakshya Hamara Paawan;
Mandir Saraswati Ka Hai,
Yah Ati Sundar Manbhaawan,
Tarah Tarah Ki Khan-paan Hai,
Bhasaon Ki Sarasata
Chanchalata Hai, Gati Unnati Hai,
Madhu Din-Raat Barasta;
Are Desh Ki Mahashakti Ka
Yehi To Hai Udgam.

Hijli Ke Aakash Ke Niche
Ek Naya Jeevan Hai,
Naye Lakshya Hain Naye Praan Hain,
Nutan Parivartan Hai.
Phul Khilen Hain Dali-Dali,
Is Upvan Ke Kyari-Kyari,
Karagaar bhi Dhanya Ho Gaya,
Bana Sanskriti ka Sangam.
IIT hai Garv Desh ka
Abhinandan-Abhinandan.

Does anyone have a link to the song sung in proper tune?

Can we translate this properly to all Indian and Foreign Languages?

#IITKGP #IITKgp

  • Posted on 29-07-2017 at 11:19AM

  • Posted on 28-07-2017 at 08:57PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The number of seats (to be filled through JEE counselling) lying vacant in IITs this year is highest in the last four years. Out of the total 10,962 available seats in 23 IITs, 121 remained vacant after completion of the counselling for admission, minister of state for human resource development Mahendra Nath Pandey told the Rajya Sabha today in a written reply.
IIT BHU has the maximum number of empty (32), followed by IIT (ISM) Dhanbad (23), IIT Jammu (13) and IIT Kharagpur (9). One seat each is vacant at IIT Bombay, IIT Madras, IIT Ropar, IIT Palakkad and IIT Goa.
The last round of counselling was held on July 19. All the IITs were supposed to complete admissions by July 25.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-07-2017 at 08:35PM

Hello Guys!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 27-07-2017 at 08:12PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

As per the recent data released by MHRD, 889 students have dropped out of IITs in the academic year of 2016-17. Out of these, 630 were Post Graduate students, 196 were PhD scholars and 63 were undergraduates. There has been a 35% rise in the number of dropouts as compared to previous year.
“The main reason for PhD and postgraduate students leaving courses midway are offers for placement in public sector enterprises and personal preference for better opportunities elsewhere”, as stated by the MHRD. Also, some undergraduates left due to their poor performances as well.
Another reason given by the MHRD for students dropping out mid way was the shortage of faculty. As of now, 4,500 seats (38%) remain vacant out of 13,012 seats. To address the problem, the ministry has decided to allow faculty working under central autonomous bodies to join IITs.
Interestingly, the recently set up IITs in Tirupati, Bhilai, Goa, Dharwad, Jammu and Dhanbad (formerly Indian School of Mines) have seen no dropouts. Most dropouts were from IIT-Roorkee (27%), followed by Delhi (20.6%), Kanpur (17.4%) and Kharagpur (10.6%).

  • View the post
  • Posted on 27-07-2017 at 08:10PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

“Every student in technical institute should undergo three internships each spanning four to eight weeks before completion of his/her under-graduation course. The responsibility will be on the institute to help students find a suitable industry for the internship,” Union HRD minister Javadekar was quoted as telling the Lok Sabha on Monday. The responsibility will be on the institute to help students find a suitable industry for the internship.
His statements come in the context of AICTE data from 2015-2016 which asserted that in 10,328 technical institutes, only 6.96 lakh students got campus placements out of 15.87 lakh students.
Meanwhile, the teachers of engineering institutes will have to take up online courses offered on government’s SWAYAM portal. “Every teacher in each of the technical discipline shall mandatorily undergo an annual refresher course through SWAYAM portal (Massive open online course), encapsulating all advances in their field of study,” the minister said.
However, it'll be interesting to see when are these decisions going to get formulated and transformed into action. This, if implemented, is surely expected to cause a huge turnaround in the field of engineering education.

Source: https://www.thequint.com/...

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Well, look no further! IIT Kharagpur is offering research grants for student-driven initiatives within the campus under its newly-launched SRIC Grant under Student Innovation Scheme (SGSIS). Grants upto Rs. 10 lakhs to be awarded!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 26-07-2017 at 09:00AM
The Scholar's Avenue

Students of IIT Kharagpur have come up with innovative ideas in the past and present which have been able to make a positive impact in the society. The Entrepreneurial ventures of students have a diversified range which generally come with an efficacious way to help out people and foster the culture of innovation.

Prazium, by Enactus, IIT Kharagpur is one such Entrepreneurial action, which has won the 6th edition of the Saint Gobain Scholarship of Rs.1,00,000 for it's initial development, which was supported by Ethos so as to find a solution to the structural design problems faced today, using sustainable and eco-friendly methods. Hitesh Vyas, a 4th year architecture student, as one of the members of Enactus, presented the project in the National level competition held in May 2017 which was declared the winner of the scholarship. It tends to reduce the cost of construction and develop houses by using processed Bamboo as a replacement for steel reinforcements.
Professor Damodar Maity of the Civil Engineering Department of IIT Kharagpur helped with the background research for this development.

Prazium is an indigenous project in collaboration with the concrete laboratories at IIT Kharagpur and some of the prototypes have been practiced in the IIT Kharagpur’s campus itself. It now aims to provide the new development to the nearby rural areas to the campus and eventually expand throughout the country.

The Scholars’ Avenue congratulates the Prazium team for their achievement and wishes them the best of luck for their future endeavors.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The deadline for the CV submission for the eligible and potential students sitting for CDC internship this year has been extended to 26th of July, 2017. Earlier the deadline was 24th of July and many of the students hadn't completed their CV submission. The major problem that students have been facing is getting the respective certificates issued by competent authorities on time. This extension of two days comes as a respite for most of the concerned students.
Students are requested to complete their CV module by the given deadline.
